results.name: Leading digit of n! in base 3.
link: David A. Corneth, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999
example: a(10) = 2 as 10! = 20211100210000_3 which has leading digit 2. - _David A. Corneth_, Jan 15 2021
program: (PARI) a(n, {b = 3}) = my(f = n!); f \ b^logint(f, b) \\ _David A. Corneth_, Jan 10 2021
results.author: _Carl R. White_, Jan 21 2008
ext: Missing a(0)=1 inserted by _David A. Corneth_, Jan 10 2021
